## Home
I design algorithms for machine learning on time series, build scalable vector search systems,
and turn research results into reliable open-source software. My work spans theory, benchmarking
methodology, and end-to-end engineering.

## Research interests

- Time series analytics: classification (BOSS, WEASEL), motif discovery (Motiflets, Leitmotifs), segmentation (ClaSP, ClaSS, ClaP)
- Vector search and high-dimensional indexing for similarity search at scale
- Benchmarking methodology and reproducible experimentation for ML systems
:::

## Open-source frameworks

- [SFA/BOSS/WEASEL Java toolkit](https://github.com/patrickzib/SFA) — scalable symbolic Fourier approximations
- [Motiflets](https://github.com/patrickzib/motiflets) — Python motif discovery for time series
- [Leitmotifs](https://github.com/patrickzib/leitmotifs) — subdimensional motif discovery
- [aeon toolkit](https://www.aeon-toolkit.org/) — Python framework for time series ML
- [ClaSS — streaming segmentation](https://github.com/ermshaua/classification-score-stream)
- [CLaP — state detection from time series](https://github.com/ermshaua/classification-label-profile)
:::
